page.title: 11Monuments
page.content: In Repton a kind of monument was found in 1982. In this year, after 10 years of excavation,{Professor Biddle}of Oxford found a battle cemetery which contained the bodies of over 150 Anglo-Saxons. The mound was discovered in the local vicarage garden. A defensive ditch was also discovered running through the church and connecting to the Old Trent. This is thought to be the site of the Viking winter camp in 874-875 and the Church itself is supposed to be the gateway for the defenses. The mass burial is thought to be the result of the defeat of the Mercian Army by the Vikings. In the Anglo-Saxon chronical it days "the Vikings came from Linsey to Repton and conquered the land" Near the church, St Wystan was originally buried but was moved by King Canute to Evesham.
